title: Microsoft Earnings, Revenue Show Strong Growth; The software giant's cloud business has benefited as the pandemic has forced people to work remotely
text:
The results beat predictions from analysts, who were expecting $50.7 billion in revenue and $17.5 billion in net income, according to FactSet.

"As tech as a percentage of global GDP continues to increase, we are innovating and investing across diverse and growing markets," said Microsoft Chief Executive Satya Nadella in a statement.

Microsoft's overall cloud revenue increased by 32% annually to $22.1 billion. Its cloud infrastructure service, called Azure, grew by 46%.

Microsoft shares slipped more than 4% in after-hours trading after the results announcement Tuesday. Even though the overall earnings numbers were better than anticipated, some investors had expected more of the quarterly growth to come from the company's cloud services, said Stifel Financial Corp. analyst Brad Reback.

Write to Aaron Tilley at aaron.tilley@wsj.com

Microsoft Earnings, Revenue Show Strong Growth
